isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - WINDSHIELD WIPERS (AIR) - OPERATION

svcproc.title: OPERATION
svcproc.para: The wiper motors operate on air pressure supplied by the vehicle air system. Reciprocating action of the wiper arm results from a reciprocating shaft in the wiper motor. To start either wiper, pull the proper control valve knob all the way out. Wiper speed is controlled by turning the knob clockwise or counter-clockwise. Push the knob in to stop the wiper motor.
